author: Staff Reporter
text:
Federation of Tamil Nadu Agriculturists’ Associations has appealed to State Government to permanently cancel the licence of any dyeing unit or a common effluent treatment plant that was caught for discharging effluents into the open.

C. Nallasamy, secretary of the Federation, said unless stringent action was taken against the erring unit, the pollution issue in Tirupur knitwear cluster would not end.

He accused that effluents were still finding its way into many water bodies especially during the night hours, despite the High Court directive to ensure zero liquid discharge in wet processing segment of the Tirupur knitwear cluster.

The Federation wanted the government to take a leaf out of China where orders were recently issued to over 10,000 industrial units in various sectors for causing pollution.
title: ‘Cancel the licence of polluting units’
